definition: to receive orders/to follow orders/to act under orders
to offer (tribute)/to present respectfully (to superior, ancestor, deity etc)/to esteem/to revere/to believe in (a religion)/to wait upon/to accept orders (from superior)
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc

sentences.english: The division headquarters was ordered to issue the evacuation was ordered.
sentences.chinese: 師部奉命下達大撤退的命令。

sentences.english: The platoon was sent to reconnoitre the village before the attack.
sentences.chinese: 在發動進攻前，這個排奉命偵察該村。

sentences.english: Security forces were ordered out to control the situation in the city.
sentences.chinese: 保安部隊奉命出動以控制市內的局面。

sentences.english: But the troops are, at this point, all under orders to deploy.
sentences.chinese: 但到目前爲止，有關部隊全部在奉命部署。

sentences.english: In late November, Northeast Field Army was ordered into the customs.
sentences.chinese: 月下旬，東北野戰軍奉命入關。

sentences.english: The soldiers were ordered to do bayonet practice.
sentences.chinese: 士兵們奉命進行劈刺訓練。

sentences.english: A naval patrol was sent to reconnoitre the approaches to the bay.
sentences.chinese: 一支海軍巡邏隊奉命偵察進入海灣的路線。

sentences.english: We were ordered to go to the 3rd Kuybyshev infantry school.
sentences.chinese: 我們奉命到第3古比雪夫步兵學校報到。

sentences.english: NEAR THE VILLAGE of Pratzen Rostov had been told to look for Kutuzov and the Emperor.
sentences.chinese: 羅斯托夫奉命在普拉茨村附近尋找庫圖佐夫和國王。

sentences.english: The police were ordered to fire into the air to make the crowd afraid.
sentences.chinese: 警察奉命向空中射擊來嚇唬羣衆。

sentences.english: The actor is bidden to undress, and wash off his powder and paint; he will be needed no more.
sentences.chinese: 演員奉命卸裝，洗去粉墨胭脂，再也用不着他了。

sentences.english: The crew were ordered to swab down the decks.
Later, he was ordered to serve again as GSO Grade 2 under Gen Chit Swe.
sentences.chinese: 後來，他奉命擔任啓遂將軍麾下二級參謀處長。

sentences.english: Clone Commander Bly carried out the order, ruthlessly killing Secura.
sentences.chinese: 布萊指揮官奉命無情地殺害了塞庫拉。

sentences.english: Anti-riot squads were called out to deal with the situation.
sentences.chinese: 奉命出動以對付這一局勢。

sentences.english: Twenty-five planes were stacked up, circling round the airport.
sentences.chinese: 架飛機奉命在機場上空作定高分層盤旋。

definition: ordained or appointed to a post/to benefit from counsel
to offer (tribute)/to present respectfully (to superior, ancestor, deity etc)/to esteem/to revere/to believe in (a religion)/to wait upon/to accept orders (from superior)
to send armed forces to suppress
to send under escort/to transport a detainee
to put down a revolt/to pacify a rebellion
